introduction.summary: May 28, 1991 (Ginbot 20) marks the fall of the Derg regime, when the Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Democratic Front (EPRDF) defeated the Derg army and took control of Addis Ababa.
introduction.significance: The day symbolizes the triumph of the people over the oppressive Derg military dictatorship that ruled Ethiopia for 17 years.
introduction.commemoration: It serves as a reminder of sacrifices made by Tigrayans and other Ethiopians in their struggle for freedom and justice.

casualties.red_terror: Tens of thousands killed, mostly youth and intelligentsia

battle_of_afabet.outcome: EPLF dealt significant blow to government troops

importance: Marked the end of Derg's brutal reign in Tigray
Highlighted indispensable role of Tigrayan fighters in defeating Derg
Ushered in new era of nations and nationalities rights

sacrifices.legacy: Continuation of Tigrayan tradition of resistance to subjugation

political: Establishment of 14 administrative regions (later revised to 11)
Recognition of nations and nationalities' right to self-determination
economic: Freedom for peasants to sell products on the market

current_challenges.governance: Concerns about centralization of power under current administration
current_challenges.human_rights: Continued violations and concerns about authoritarian tendencies

lessons.importance: Need for documentation and remembrance of historical atrocities
lessons.challenges: Young population (40% under 15, 67% under 65) disconnected from historical events
recommendations: Incorporation of lessons into political and social fabric
Ensuring justice and accountability for past crimes
Maintaining connection to history to prevent repetition of atrocities
